title: CI/CD Pipeline Failed: Build and Test - Run #98

stories.title: Fix Prettier Formatting Violations in Frontend Code
stories.rootCause: Code formatting violations in frontend test files - extra spaces and indentation that didn't match Prettier configuration, primarily in AssessmentForm.test.tsx (37 errors on lines 654-900)
stories.solution: Ran `npm run lint:fix` in frontend directory to automatically fix all 45 prettier/prettier formatting errors using ESLint's auto-fix capability
stories.impact: CI/CD pipeline was blocked preventing deployment. All developers on feature/19 branch were unable to merge changes until formatting issues were resolved
stories.verification: npm run lint shows 0 prettier/prettier errors (down from 45)

stories.title: Remove Console.log Statements from Production Code
stories.rootCause: ESLint no-console rule violations - 11 console.log statements in version utility files that violated project's linting rules (only console.warn and console.error allowed)
stories.solution: Added eslint-disable-next-line no-console comments for legitimate console.log usage in logVersionInfo function (startup logging) and test assertions that verify console logging behavior. These console statements are intentional and necessary for their purpose
stories.impact: Code quality warnings that could accumulate over time, though warnings didn't block builds in this configuration
technicalDecisions: Chose to suppress warnings with eslint-disable-next-line rather than remove console.log statements because: (1) logVersionInfo is intentionally designed to log version info on startup for debugging/support, (2) test assertions legitimately need to verify console.log was called
stories.verification: npm run lint shows 0 no-console warnings (down from 11), only 1 unrelated @typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any warning remains

summary.rootCause: ESLint violations blocking CI/CD pipeline: 45 prettier/prettier formatting errors and 11 no-console warnings in frontend code
summary.solutionApplied: Auto-fixed all formatting errors with npm run lint:fix and added appropriate eslint-disable comments for legitimate console.log usage
